settings.Name: Islands
settings.Description:
Players start in small islands while there are many others around.


An island play is any piece of sub-continental land that is surrounded by water. A grouping of geographically or geologically related islands is called an archipelago. Continental islands are bodies of land that lie on the continental shelf of a continent while oceanic islands are ones that do not sit on continental shelves and the vast majority are volcanic in origin. Their size can vary between very small and very large.
